summary: This document is a collection of administrative count sheets and rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated July 24, 2019. It includes official out-count forms, inmate rosters, and count slips, which are standard prison operational records for tracking inmate populations and assignments on that specific date.

events.title: Daily Prison Counts at MCC New York
events.description: Standard administrative inmate counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The documents record census numbers for various housing units (e.g., B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, Z-B) and include out-count procedures and inmate rosters.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated July 24, 2019, which is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
These are routine prison administrative records (count sheets, rosters) showing standard operational procedures for tracking inmates.
The records show a total inmate census of 774 (with a verify count of 772) across multiple housing units at the MCC.
One inmate roster entry lists an assignment category of "HOSP" and an assignment description of "SUICIDE OR UNASSG," which may be related to Epstein's status.
The documents themselves contain no named individuals, only procedural forms and counts.
